ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Bookmark 'stability'
ygData.msgSnippet: ... No 410 at least, because 410 means: “The requested resource is no longer available at the server and no forwarding address is known.”

> I'm not sure what the practical convention for 301, or 308, is, but to
> =
me it sounds like the server could chose to return a 404 or maybe more
> ap=
propriately a 410 (Gone) in the future.

No 410 at least, because 410 means=
:
=93The requested resource is no longer available at the server and no for=
warding address is known.=94
(http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2616#section-10=
.4.11)

Note how it says =93at the server=94, which means that a forwarding=
 address should necessarily be on another server.
So 410 seems not acceptab=
le if the resource has changed URI but is still on the server.

404 is, how=
ever, more vague:
=93The server has not found anything matching the Request=
-URI.=94

Best,

Ruben
